results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Murder Under the Mistletoe (Series 02. Ep. 13)
results.creator_credit: Tony Tilse, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: Phryne, Dot and Dr Mac happily accompany Aunt Prudence to a picturesque chalet to celebrate a white Christmas in July. The party arrives to find one of the residents dead – electrocuted while hanging festive lights. No more suspicious than the usual Miss Fisher investigation, until the body count starts to rapidly rise. Heavy snowfalls and harsh weather trap them all with a murderer in their midst – and any one of them the next victim. It’s a race against time for Phryne and Jack to hunt down the culprit – and restore enough Christmas joy to take full advantage should they find themselves standing under that bunch of that mistletoe! [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Murder on the Ballarat train  (Series 01. Ep. 02)
results.creator_credit: Kate Dennis, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: The glamorous Phryne Fisher (Essie Davis), accompanied by her maid Dot, decide to travel to the country by train to collect her new Hispano-Suiza motor car.The charm of rail travel soon evaporates though, when Phryne unexpectedly has to use her trusty pearl-handled pistol to save a young woman’s life and solve the disappearance of her fellow passenger’s mother. Her train trip derailed by a gruesome murder, Phryne speeds home in her Hispano-Suiza to her new abode in St Kilda where she works through the clues until she discovers her unassuming murderer. [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Hispano Suiza
results.creator_credit: Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description:
Learn more about the luxury motor car that appears in the series, Phryne’s red ‘Hispano-Suiza’.
One of the luxury cars of the 1920s, the ‘Hispano-Suiza’ was favoured by royalty, film stars and moguls. The name means “Spanish Swiss”, but the car was manufactured in France, as explained by its owner, Bob, who spent twelve years restoring what had been “just a heap of rusty bits”. His successful restoration adds an authentic glamour to Phryne’s motoring.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Dead Air (Series 02. Ep. 11)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Millar, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: There’s a new wireless in the Fisher household – but there’s murder on the airwaves when Dot’s new favourite show is interrupted by an on air panic. The radio station’s bookkeeper and budding announcer is found choked to death but when Phryne gets involved, she finds Jack already undercover as the newsreader. In an ironic turnaround, Phryne is officially engaged to investigate the death - as Jack resorts to more clandestine investigative strategies. In the cut and thrust of the investigation, Dot suffers the terrible realisation that she doesn’t want to relinquish working for Miss Fisher when she marries and takes up her wifely duties. [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Costume Designer Marion Boyce
results.creator_credit: Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description:
Meet Marion Boyce, costume designer for ‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’ as she discusses some of the process involved in recreating the look and feel of the 1920s for the popular television series.
Boyce muses on the “sumptuous elegance” of fashion in the nineteen twenties, a period she describes as one of “extreme excess in a lot of ways …. they lived a lot with gay abandon”. She highlights the flattering silhouette bestowed by 1920s men’s fashion of the time, dwells lovingly on the exotic and embellished fabrics of the time, and talks about the use of original pieces - buckles, shoes, feathers and furs - to heighten the authenticity of the costumes.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Cocaine Blues (Series 01. Ep. 01)
results.creator_credit: Tony Tilse, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: The Honourable Miss Phryne Fisher disembarks the Orient at Victoria Dock, returning to Melbourne after years abroad. Almost as soon as she checks into the Windsor Hotel, Phryne is embroiled in mystery: poisoned husbands, cocaine smuggling rings and illegal abortionists – not to mention erotic encounters with the handsome Russian dancer, Sasha de Lisse. Her adventure reaches its steamy end in the Turkish Bath Palace off Little Lonsdale Street. [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.creator_credit: Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: Get a glimpse of Series Three with this short promotional trailer. Intrigue, murder, mystery and a sense of style and flair we see hints of the 2015 Series in this fast paced colourful trailer.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries
results.brief_description: Our lady sleuth sashays through the back lanes and jazz clubs of late-1920s Melbourne, fighting injustice with her pearl handled pistol and dagger sharp wit. Leaving a trail of admirers in her wake, our thoroughly modern heroine makes sure she enjoys every moment of her lucky life.

constellations_other.name: Monsters, murder and mystery
constellations_other.description: Murder and mystery hide in the shadows born from German Expressionism.

results.description: Our lady sleuth sashays through the back lanes and jazz clubs of late 1920s Melbourne, fighting injustice with her pearl handled pistol and her dagger sharp wit. Leaving a trail of admirers in her wake, our thoroughly modern heroine makes sure she enjoys every moment of her lucky life. Based on author Kerry Greenwood’s Phryne Fisher Murder Mystery novels.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Melbourne: Before and After Visual Effects
results.brief_description: This short work shows how digital special effects are employed to capture ‘before’ and ‘after’ shots to make 2015 Melbourne appear as 1920s Melbourne. These have been produced for ‘Behind the Scenes’ of the series produced by Every Cloud Productions shown on ABC television ‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’.

results.title: Miss Congeniality
results.creator_credit: Donald Petrie, Marc Lawrence, Sandra Bullock, Fortis Film and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: FBI special agent Gracie Hart is a man’s woman - she chews with her mouth open, snorts when she laughs, has one eyebrow and is having a “bad hair decade”…So when the FBI needs to send an undercover agent into the famed Miss United States Pageant, Agent Hart certainly isn’t their first choice, she’s their only choice. Cast includes: Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, William Shatner, Candice Bergen, Benjamin Bratt.
